markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

mcall.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for The Morning Call, a daily newspaper serving the Lehigh Valley of eastern Pennsylvania and western New Jersey. The Morning Call is based in Allentown, Pennsylvania.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Morning Call is owned by Tribune Publishing Company, a publicly traded, Chicago-based media and publishing company formerly known as Tronc Inc. Tribune owns newspapers and publications in major markets, including The Baltimore Sun, New York Daily News, Orlando Sentinel, and its flagship publication, the Chicago Tribune.

Tribune generates its revenue through advertising and subscriptions for its printed and digital products. Its publications have won numerous awards, including a Pulitzer Prize in 2017.

Content

The website publishes local, state, national, and international news. Mcall.com does original local reporting and has a correspondent based in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, the state capital, and one in Washington.

Sections on the site include News, Communities, Capitol Ideas, Sports, Entertainment, Reviews, Business, and Obituaries. A Special Reports section offers a variety of more in-depth articles, photo essays, and interactive features. A feature headlined “Acres of Tax Breaks,” for example, includes a tax bill calculator function.

The site relies on The Associated Press and other news agencies for national and international news. It also offers a reporter-hosted podcast, Valley View, that addresses top stories in the Lehigh Valley and explores the impact of broader trends on the community. A tab on the website converts the site to an e-newspaper format -- a digital version of The Morning Call that looks like the print version, with arrows to turn the pages.

Credibility

Stories are well-sourced and credited to writers, with headlines and images accurately reflecting their content. Photographs are credited to staff or photo services. Opinion pages are clearly identified, with a mix of editorials, local op-ed columns, and national columnists.

Corrections are posted with stories, marked as  For the Record.

Transparency

Mcall.com provides extensive information about its ownership, and posts a staff directory provides names and email addresses for editors and reporters. Bylines link to reporters’ biographical information. Advertisements are clearly identified.

History

The website was launched in 1996, more than a century after the first edition of The Morning Call -- then named The Critic -- was founded in 1883 by Samuel S. Woolever. The paper later changed hands and was renamed The Morning Call in 1895. That same year, David A. Miller, who was a reporter at the paper, and his brother Samuel Miller started buying shares in the newspaper. The Millers became the The Morning Call’s sole owners in 1904, and the family owned or worked for the paper for most of the next 80 years. It was sold to The Times Mirror Publishing Company in 1984 and to Tribune Publishing in 2000.

The site’s About Us page describes The Morning Call as the third-largest newspaper in Pennsylvania.

Written by:
Pam Weber-Leaf

Edited by:
Peggy Ackermann Eric Effron
